title: Geth v.1.13.1 - BAD BLOCK - Invalid merkle root - Error when I make a transaction
body:
I'm running my own 3 node PoA private blockchain and trying to notarize on the blockchain some hashes. It worked fine before, but when I reached about 30 blocks this strange error started popping up that I had never seen before...


The even stranger thing is that the tx is processed by one block, but by the others it is put in pending and is no longer resolved. it's as if the blocks don't sync somehow.

Below I try to give as much information as possible:

**genesis.json**
```
{
  "config": {
    "chainId": 10001,
    "homesteadBlock": 0,
    "eip150Block": 0,
    "eip155Block": 0,
    "eip158Block": 0,
    "byzantiumBlock": 0,
    "constantinopleBlock": 0,
    "petersburgBlock": 0,
    "istanbulBlock": 0,
    "berlinBlock": 0,
    "clique": {
      "period": 0,
      "epoch": 30000
    }
  },
  "difficulty": "1",
  "gasLimit": "8000000",
  "extradata": "",
  "alloc": {
    "C7157684459e99ba5046185e421ab51A96EDeD8D": { "balance": "100000000000000000000" },
    "6f2f4eed9970E70F23f3e51B8511D8967d72ACE8": { "balance": "100000000000000000000" },
    "49A7e812AA2B459241a375f546D2434C7213A94c": { "balance": "100000000000000000000" }
  }
}
```

**node start command**
`geth --datadir node1 --networkid 10001 --allow-insecure-unlock --unlock $PUB_ADDR --http --port 30313 --http.addr $PRIVATE_IP_ADDR --http.port 8546 --http.corsdomain '*' --http.vhosts '*' --authrpc.port 8552 --http.api admin,eth,miner,net,txpool,personal,web3 --syncmode full --ipcdisable --mine --miner.etherbase $PUB_ADDR --preload $FILENAME_JS --password "psw.txt" console`

**JS file in preload**
```
admin.addPeer("enode://7e8175b0e31200c0f09b3141432b357981e5c15db2056b99a10f8fe11dc477ac0a7f2ac77b1e056df3ed8a31458a3d6fdd6daa80bdff09c0aa4905a55dd71538@<myip>:30313")

admin.addPeer("enode://e5ce2f1f5d377eb61201d81ceecd400642cd4db5e393bb3f488b4870f2472b73720d69443c28aaed6014480a476ca35d1319c82a0bc95ee9e35f6773181029d0@<myip>:30314")

admin.addPeer("enode://981ccfafb0edd3ec899b4f9f447c0f32a9956af1834c8dd91161fc8d5b5c4babd24e39d1feb8aa978219b8feb91e80116f2cb7be32defe1672faded630f3796b@<myip>:30315")

admin.addTrustedPeer("enode://7e8175b0e31200c0f09b3141432b357981e5c15db2056b99a10f8fe11dc477ac0a7f2ac77b1e056df3ed8a31458a3d6fdd6daa80bdff09c0aa4905a55dd71538@<myip>:30313")

admin.addTrustedPeer("enode://e5ce2f1f5d377eb61201d81ceecd400642cd4db5e393bb3f488b4870f2472b73720d69443c28aaed6014480a476ca35d1319c82a0bc95ee9e35f6773181029d0@<myip>:30314")

admin.addTrustedPeer("enode://981ccfafb0edd3ec899b4f9f447c0f32a9956af1834c8dd91161fc8d5b5c4babd24e39d1feb8aa978219b8feb91e80116f2cb7be32defe1672faded630f3796b@<myip>:30315")
```

**The Error**
```
########## BAD BLOCK #########
Block: 31 (0x6e8f0dc4ee61f8b69506a727d0689ead2709d03e546a8b8725979bf3581ee57e)
Error: invalid merkle root (remote: 202c0300a9f213a2cdcc46fede91dbdc1921c872bc46d9608a8d877b16df62ed local: a2f5f31b7e2b7f9e45fd45adb7740e9d549a49186942aeb97ae6f5d5e9f59b95) dberr: %!w(<nil>)
Platform: geth (devel) go1.21.1 amd64 linux
VCS: 3f40e65c-
Chain config: &params.ChainConfig{ChainID:10001, HomesteadBlock:0, DAOForkBlock:<nil>, DAOForkSupport:false, EIP150Block:0, EIP155Block:0, EIP158Block:0, ByzantiumBlock:0, ConstantinopleBlock:0, PetersburgBlock:0, IstanbulBlock:0, MuirGlacierBlock:<nil>, BerlinBlock:0, LondonBlock:<nil>, ArrowGlacierBlock:<nil>, GrayGlacierBlock:<nil>, MergeNetsplitBlock:<nil>, ShanghaiTime:(*uint64)(nil), CancunTime:(*uint64)(nil), PragueTime:(*uint64)(nil), VerkleTime:(*uint64)(nil), TerminalTotalDifficulty:<nil>, TerminalTotalDifficultyPassed:false, Ethash:(*params.EthashConfig)(nil), Clique:(*params.CliqueConfig)(0xc000786250), IsDevMode:false}
Receipts:
  0: cumulative: 215222 gas: 215222 contract: 0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000 status: 1 tx: 0x1596136cf33cfb487786ddc8cb26bb85d1c9e58eac9cab4234ef696d3c4b9c80 logs: [] bloom:  state:
##############################
```

Can anyone tell me how to resolve this error?

```[tasklist]
### Tasks
```
Do you know which node mined the block? And what software version is that node using?

Yes, I know which block was mined and the software that this node uses is always version 1.13.1.

*I added more details above*

** EDIT **
I found this person's answer in another ticket saying that the problem is in the "period" field in genesis.json which must be at least 5. 
[#15504](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/15504#issuecomment-619829424)
What do you think?

** EDIT2 **

Apparently a problem launching geth as services on my linux system with systemctl.

If I run geth normally no errors appear, while with systemctl, apparently, at least I think, since it crashes, for some reason it crashes the blocks which consequently generate the error indicated above.

However, if I start 2 out of 3 nodes with systemctl and at least one node starts with geth normally, the transactions work. If I put everything on systemctl the transactions don't work, sometimes yes, sometimes no and then, subsequently, it's as if it generates the BAD BLOCK error

How can I solve this problem with systemctl ?

One thing you could do is use `debug.standardTraceBadBlockToFile("0x6e8f0dc4ee61f8b69506a727d0689ead2709d03e546a8b8725979bf3581ee57e")` on the machine which rejects the block, and 
debug.standardTraceBlockToFile("0x6e8f0dc4ee61f8b69506a727d0689ead2709d03e546a8b8725979bf3581ee57e")` on the one which mined it (or any node that has accepted it. THen you could compare the two traces, and see if there are any differences in execution of that transaction. 
Alternatively, if you upload the two traces somewhere, I can take a look at it.

I print out the logs, here the outputs:

**Node 1 (the node that mined the block)**

```
> debug.standardTraceBlockToFile("0x4e4b6fc248906c0fc3b7231f5063b774a97ec22543cd270e72bec24bbecb3129")
INFO [09-19|16:36:59.171] Wrote standard trace                     file=/tmp/block_0x4e4b6fc2-0-0x7c7977f3-3227586541
["/tmp/block_0x4e4b6fc2-0-0x7c7977f3-3227586541"]
```

**Node 2 and Node 3 (the nodes where the bad block error came out)**

```
> debug.standardTraceBlockToFile("0x4e4b6fc248906c0fc3b7231f5063b774a97ec22543cd270e72bec24bbecb3129")
WARN [09-19|16:36:18.749] Served debug_standardTraceBlockToFile    reqid=18 duration="112.65µs"  err="block 0x4e4b6fc248906c0fc3b7231f5063b774a97ec22543cd270e72bec24bbecb3129 not found"
Error: block 0x4e4b6fc248906c0fc3b7231f5063b774a97ec22543cd270e72bec24bbecb3129 not found
        at web3.js:6365:9(39)
        at send (web3.js:5099:62(29))
        at <eval>:1:31(3)
```

**Node 1 Trace file**  (Other nodes do not generate the file)

[https://gist.github.com/Alessandro-Cavaliere/979c9f0116dffdae870a9e133e531d97](https://gist.github.com/Alessandro-Cavaliere/979c9f0116dffdae870a9e133e531d97)
The nodes require different commands (check what I wrote above).

Sorry,

Below is what I did wrong and the logs for the node that returned the error using the method `debug.standardTraceBadBlockToFile()`. Node 1 trace file in the previous comment should be correct.
here the updated outputs:


**Node 2  (the node where the bad block error came out)**

[https://gist.github.com/Alessandro-Cavaliere/183f615fb0bee52e8249a1be84f19cb7](https://gist.github.com/Alessandro-Cavaliere/183f615fb0bee52e8249a1be84f19cb7)
